page.title: 15CARPENDERS PARK STREET NAMES
page.content: {LEIGH RODD.}Old English LEAH or modern LEA,a glade or open land in a wood. RODD,Old English ROD or modern ROAD meaning a clearing.{HANGAR RUDING}. HANGAR,slope or wood on slope from Old English HANGRA.RUDING,clearing from Old English RYDDING.{DELTA GAIN} .DELTA,flow of roads towards the centre.GAIN,the winning of trade and enterprise.{UPPER HITCH.}HITCH,an enclosure or hurdles for sheep.{ {MARGEHOLES.}The name of original woods north of By The Wood.{FOXLEYS.}Same origin as LEIGH,especially cultivated land under grass.{UPPER,LOWER TAIL.} TAIL,narrow strip of land used in Danelaw counties.{THE MEAD.}Field name also used in Danelaw counties.{GIBBS {COUCH.}Local name suggested by the county archivist.
